intro: Chamaesyce trancapatae, commonly known as the Cape verde sandmat, is a low-growing flowering plant native to the Cape Verde Islands. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its growth habit is prostrate, often forming dense mats on rocky or sandy soils. The flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, contributing to its ecological role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
